result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Matthew Block was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligibile for SAP only after serving at least 5 years initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: (including $250 drug buy money) to be paid during extended supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done & no surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and approved in advance by agent and then only according to Dr.'s orders.
No contact with T.K.
No contact with co-defendant (R.V.)
No contact with known drug users or sellers.

Defendant Joseph Matthew Block in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant Joseph Matthew Block in custody.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:  
Count 1 - 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  Credit for 154 days.
Count 2 - 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to count 1.  
Defendant is not eligible for CIP.  Defendant is eligible for SAP only after serving at least 5 years initial confinement.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done & no surcharge.
Costs & fees + $250 buy money all to be paid during extended supervision.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and approved in advance by agent and then only according to Dr.'s orders.
No contact with T.K.
No contact with co-defendant
No contact with known drug users or sellers
